security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation. No executable code, no network calls, no file system access beyond git metadata reading. All shell commands are instructional examples for AI workflow guidance.

content.user_title: Create GitHub pull requests with validation
content.value_statement: Creating pull requests with proper formatting takes time and attention to detail. This skill automates PR creation by validating tasks, running tests, and generating Conventional Commits messages automatically.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes commits to determine PR type and scope
Validates task completion and test execution
Generates Conventional Commits formatted PR titles
Suggests appropriate labels based on commit types
Confirms target branch with user before creating PR
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) to be installed and authenticated
Cannot create PRs without user confirmation
Relies on existing test commands (make test, npm test, pytest)

use_cases.title: Bugfix PR submission

prompt_templates.title: Create feature PR
prompt_templates.scenario: Submit a new feature for review
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PR from my current branch to develop. Use the github-pr-creation skill.

prompt_templates.title: Create bugfix PR
prompt_templates.scenario: Submit a bug fix for review
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PR for this fix to the develop branch. Include bug and bugfix labels.

prompt_templates.title: Create release PR
prompt_templates.scenario: Merge develop to main for release
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a release PR from develop to main. Verify all tests pass first.

prompt_templates.title: Custom PR with context
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PR with custom labels and extended description covering the following changes: [describe your changes]

output_examples.input: Create a PR from my feature branch to develop
output: ‚úì Generating PR title: feat(auth): add OAuth2 login support

best_practices: Always confirm the target branch before creating PR
Run tests first to ensure code quality
Use Conventional Commits for consistent PR titles
anti_patterns: Creating PRs without reviewing the generated content
Skipping test validation before PR submission
Not confirming branch names with the user

faq.question: Which tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Requires GitHub CLI (gh) installed.

faq.question: What test frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: Supports Makefile, npm test, and pytest. Add custom test commands in project configuration.

faq.question: Does this modify my code?
faq.answer: No. This skill performs read-only analysis and only creates PRs with your confirmation.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. No data is sent externally. All git operations run locally on your machine.

faq.question: Why is GitHub CLI required?
faq.answer: GitHub CLI provides secure authentication and PR creation without exposing tokens in URLs.

faq.question: How is this different from default PR creation?
faq.answer: This skill adds validation, Conventional Commits formatting, and automatic label suggestions.
